--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "j_cumps" <j_cumps@...> wrote:
>
> Most IDEs =
don't use your classpath variable. You have to configure 
> the classpath i=
n your IDE's project options. How to do this depends 
> on the IDE you are =
using.
> 
> The best way to get this question answered is to search in the =
IDE's 
> documentation how to add a jar to your project classpath.

Yeeeeee=
sh. It's not in the docs for JJ Edit, but that information is
in the releas=
e notes on the IDE's webpage.

If any other JJ Edit users run into this pro=
blem, it's not in
Preferences..., but Window/Customize Toolbar..., then dra=
g the
Classpath field to the toolbar.
